title: Ruggable Is Offering 20% Off Washable Styles From Goop, Iris Apfel, and More
description: So many cool prints to choose from! READ MORE...
author: Nikol Slatinska
excerpt: So many cool prints to choose from!
text: DecoratingDecor & AccessoriesNikol SlatinskaCommerce Shopping WriterNikol SlatinskaCommerce Shopping WriterI write home shopping content for Apartment Therapy. My job entails product testing and reviewing, as well as writing serviceable shopping guides for furniture and home decor. I received my undergraduate journalism degree at the University of Missouri and wrote for local publications in my college town. published nowWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.One challenge I’m giving myself for 2025 is to try more new things. Broad, I know, but I want to expand my horizons in a variety of categories. One of them is home decor. I caught some flak from friends this past year for having bland taste when it comes to the prints and colors (or lack thereof) that I gravitate toward. Although I love my neutrals, I can admit that introducing more prints and vibrant hues into my space could benefit the overall look and mood of my apartment. If you think your home could also use a visual boost, the place I recommend hitting up first is Ruggable. Known for its designer rug collaborations, Ruggable has released collections over the years with everyone from Jonathan Adler to Iris Apfel to the “Bridgerton” Netflix series. And now, Ruggable is offering 20% off sitewide with code EOY24 during its end-of-year sale, meaning you can score a brand-new area rug for a great price. There are so many fun styles to choose from, and many of them are washable or otherwise made for high-traffic areas. Below, I’ve listed what I think are the most exciting designs — so have a look, and maybe pick the one that challenges you.1 / 10Ruggable$295.20was $369.00Ruggable's Morris & Co. collab is full of flowery motifs that'll make your favorite spaces look brighter. The Blackthorn rug sports one of the more intricate prints; you could easily get lost in its captivating vines and blooms. The dark green model is also great for stark spaces that could use some dimension.2 / 10Ruggable$327.20was $409.00Sink your feet into pure luxury with the Egret rug. Its plush, cloudlike texture and clean white color make it a dreamy addition to bedrooms, living rooms, or anywhere you want ultimate comfort. Despite its high-pile construction, the Egret is stain- and water-resistant.3 / 10Ruggable$295.20was $369.00Inject some whimsy into your favorite sitting area with this fairy-like rug. Characterized by a kaleidoscopic butterfly print and rich jewel tones, the floor covering serves as a refreshing departure from the minimalistic rugs you see all the time. It comes in a dark and light version, and it's sure to get you a ton of compliments.4 / 10Ruggable$287.20was $359.00Add a subtle pop of color to your hallway or home office with the goop collab’s Luna rug. It features a demure diamond motif and matching cream border. The Luna is eye-catching but unassuming; reviewers describe its overall appearance as neat yet modern.5 / 10Ruggable$231.20was $289.00You might recognize some of the details in the Alice rug as taking inspiration from '70s design, which makes this the perfect pick for those who are after a vintage aesthetic. Its large-scale florals also invoke Egyptian papyrus flowers that’ll play well with potted plant decor. Despite the busy print, this rug sports a neutral-enough color scheme of yellows, browns, and pinks, which makes it easier to style than you might initially think.6 / 10Ruggable$295.20was $369.00Channel elegant Regency vibes with the Lady Whistledown rug from Ruggable’s “Bridgerton” collection. Available in two colors, it features delicate floral and crown motifs, as well as a slightly distressed appearance that lends a vintage vibe.7 / 10Ruggable$287.20was $359.00Those after a unique statement piece can't go wrong with this Jonathan Adler peacock-inspired rug. It’s rare to see a print at this large a scale, but it definitely works in this case. You can keep all other accessories and furniture simple when you add this piece, or mix and match with small-scale prints to create an eye-pleasing contrast.8 / 10Ruggable$247.20was $309.00This geometric-printed number will instantly warm up your living space with its pink-and-orange color scheme. It’s also available in a charcoal or navy hue — but no matter which one you opt for, the Rayne rug’s intricate motif will make your home look that much more stunning.9 / 10Ruggable$247.20was $309.00The Kamran rug features a cool-toned color scheme, along with a bold geometric pattern and washed-out, rustic finish. It also comes in a bunch of colors and, as is the case with most of Ruggable’s rugs, you can choose between either a tufted or flatwoven cover. The tufted cover is extra soft, though.10 / 10Ruggable$287.20was $359.00Those into the cottage aesthetic will love the Sutton rug from Ruggable’s collaboration with The Home Edit. Its checked print might be traditional, but the light blue and moss green colors prevent it from looking stuffy. If anything, this pick will make your kitchen feel bright and airy.
html:
• Decorating
  • Decor & Accessories

Nikol SlatinskaCommerce Shopping Writer

Nikol SlatinskaCommerce Shopping Writer

I write home shopping content for Apartment Therapy. My job entails product testing and reviewing, as well as writing serviceable shopping guides for furniture and home decor. I received my undergraduate journalism degree at the University of Missouri and wrote for local publications in my college town.

published now

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

One challenge I’m giving myself for 2025 is to try more new things. Broad, I know, but I want to expand my horizons in a variety of categories. One of them is home decor. I caught some flak from friends this past year for having bland taste when it comes to the prints and colors (or lack thereof) that I gravitate toward. Although I love my neutrals, I can admit that introducing more prints and vibrant hues into my space could benefit the overall look and mood of my apartment. If you think your home could also use a visual boost, the place I recommend hitting up first is Ruggable. 

Known for its designer rug collaborations, Ruggable has released collections over the years with everyone from Jonathan Adler to Iris Apfel to the “Bridgerton” Netflix series. And now, Ruggable is offering 20% off sitewide with code EOY24 during its end-of-year sale, meaning you can score a brand-new area rug for a great price. There are so many fun styles to choose from, and many of them are washable or otherwise made for high-traffic areas. Below, I’ve listed what I think are the most exciting designs — so have a look, and maybe pick the one that challenges you.

1 / 10

Ruggable

$295.20

was $369.00

Ruggable's Morris & Co. collab is full of flowery motifs that'll make your favorite spaces look brighter. The Blackthorn rug sports one of the more intricate prints; you could easily get lost in its captivating vines and blooms. The dark green model is also great for stark spaces that could use some dimension.

2 / 10

Ruggable

$327.20

was $409.00

Sink your feet into pure luxury with the Egret rug. Its plush, cloudlike texture and clean white color make it a dreamy addition to bedrooms, living rooms, or anywhere you want ultimate comfort. Despite its high-pile construction, the Egret is stain- and water-resistant.

3 / 10

Ruggable

$295.20

was $369.00

Inject some whimsy into your favorite sitting area with this fairy-like rug. Characterized by a kaleidoscopic butterfly print and rich jewel tones, the floor covering serves as a refreshing departure from the minimalistic rugs you see all the time. It comes in a dark and light version, and it's sure to get you a ton of compliments.

4 / 10

Ruggable

$287.20

was $359.00

Add a subtle pop of color to your hallway or home office with the goop collab’s Luna rug. It features a demure diamond motif and matching cream border. The Luna is eye-catching but unassuming; reviewers describe its overall appearance as neat yet modern.

5 / 10

Ruggable

$231.20

was $289.00

You might recognize some of the details in the Alice rug as taking inspiration from '70s design, which makes this the perfect pick for those who are after a vintage aesthetic. Its large-scale florals also invoke Egyptian papyrus flowers that’ll play well with potted plant decor. Despite the busy print, this rug sports a neutral-enough color scheme of yellows, browns, and pinks, which makes it easier to style than you might initially think.

6 / 10

Ruggable

$295.20

was $369.00

Channel elegant Regency vibes with the Lady Whistledown rug from Ruggable’s “Bridgerton” collection. Available in two colors, it features delicate floral and crown motifs, as well as a slightly distressed appearance that lends a vintage vibe.

7 / 10

Ruggable

$287.20

was $359.00

Those after a unique statement piece can't go wrong with this Jonathan Adler peacock-inspired rug. It’s rare to see a print at this large a scale, but it definitely works in this case. You can keep all other accessories and furniture simple when you add this piece, or mix and match with small-scale prints to create an eye-pleasing contrast.

8 / 10

Ruggable

$247.20

was $309.00

This geometric-printed number will instantly warm up your living space with its pink-and-orange color scheme. It’s also available in a charcoal or navy hue — but no matter which one you opt for, the Rayne rug’s intricate motif will make your home look that much more stunning.

9 / 10

Ruggable

$247.20

was $309.00

The Kamran rug features a cool-toned color scheme, along with a bold geometric pattern and washed-out, rustic finish. It also comes in a bunch of colors and, as is the case with most of Ruggable’s rugs, you can choose between either a tufted or flatwoven cover. The tufted cover is extra soft, though.

10 / 10

Ruggable

$287.20

was $359.00

Those into the cottage aesthetic will love the Sutton rug from Ruggable’s collaboration with The Home Edit. Its checked print might be traditional, but the light blue and moss green colors prevent it from looking stuffy. If anything, this pick will make your kitchen feel bright and airy.
